item.title: Political Influencers Are Ramping Up Security—and Posting Through It
item.description: In the wake of Charlie Kirk’s killing, political influencers have to balance security and the requirements of the job. “Part of my rate is the ‘someone might kill me tax,’” says one.

item.title: Political Influencers Are Ramping Up Security—and Posting Through It
item.description: In the wake of Charlie Kirk’s killing, political influencers have to balance security and the requirements of the job. “Part of my rate is the ‘someone might kill me tax,’” says one.

item.title: Inside Trumpworld’s Reality Distortion Field
item.description: In the immediate aftermath of Charlie Kirk’s killing, Donald Trump’s advisors were sure who was to blame. Whether they actually were didn’t, and doesn’t, much seem to matter.

item.description: In the immediate aftermath of Charlie Kirk’s killing, Donald Trump’s advisors were sure who was to blame. Whether they actually were didn’t, and doesn’t, much seem to matter.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Shooting Suspect Charged as Prosecutor Seeks Death Penalty
item.description: In the indictment, prosecutors claim Tyler Robinson planned Kirk’s killing in advance, citing rooftop surveillance, engraved bullets, and a written note as they seek the death penalty.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Shooting Suspect Charged as Prosecutor Seeks Death Penalty
item.description: In the indictment, prosecutors claim Tyler Robinson planned Kirk’s killing in advance, citing rooftop surveillance, engraved bullets, and a written note as they seek the death penalty.

item.title: WIRED Roundup: How Charlie Kirk Changed Conservative Media
item.description: On this episode of “Uncanny Valley,” we discuss the legacy of Charlie Kirk and the aftermath of his murder.

item.title: Bullets Found After the Charlie Kirk Shooting Carried Messages. Here’s What They Mean
item.description: The inscriptions on bullets recovered near the scene of Charlie Kirk’s murder appear to reference video games like Helldivers 2 and online furry role-play, not a legible political ideology.

item.description: The inscriptions on bullets recovered near the scene of Charlie Kirk’s murder appear to reference video games like Helldivers 2 and online furry role-play, not a legible political ideology.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Shooting Suspect Identified as 22-Year-Old Utah Man
item.description: Authorities have named Tyler Robinson as a suspect in the murder of right-wing influencer Charlie Kirk, citing Discord messages as evidence of his alleged role.

item.description: Authorities have named Tyler Robinson as a suspect in the murder of right-wing influencer Charlie Kirk, citing Discord messages as evidence of his alleged role.

item.title: Scenes From Charlie Kirk's Spontaneous Memorial in Utah
item.description: Outside of the Utah hospital where Charlie Kirk was taken Wednesday, a crowd of families, college students, and Proud Boys gathered to mourn.

item.title: Right-Wing Activists Are Targeting People for Allegedly Celebrating Charlie Kirk's Death
item.description: Extremists and an anonymously run website are posting identifying details about people accused of celebrating Charlie Kirk’s murder online. Some of those targeted are now getting death threats.

item.title: Right-Wing Activist Charlie Kirk Dead at 31
item.description: Turning Point USA cofounder Charlie Kirk died after he was shot at an event at Utah Valley University on Wednesday.

item.title: Right-Wing Activist Charlie Kirk Dead at 31
item.description: Turning Point USA cofounder Charlie Kirk died after he was shot at an event at Utah Valley University on Wednesday.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Is Dead After Utah Valley University Shooting
item.description: Turning Point USA cofounder Charlie Kirk was shot at an event at Utah Valley University on Wednesday. He later died from his injuries.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Is Dead After Utah Valley University Shooting
item.description: Turning Point USA cofounder Charlie Kirk was shot at an event at Utah Valley University on Wednesday. He later died from his injuries.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Shot at Utah Valley University Event
item.description: Turning Point USA cofounder Charlie Kirk was shot at an event at Utah Valley University on Wednesday. A suspect is in custody, according to campus police, but details remain murky.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Shot at Utah Valley University Event
item.description: Turning Point USA cofounder Charlie Kirk was shot at an event at Utah Valley University on Wednesday. A suspect is in custody, according to campus police, but details remain murky.

item.title: Melania Trump’s AI Era Is Upon Us
item.description: The ever elusive first lady has emerged with a brief to exert thought leadership over AI, for the children. Some insiders are excited; others won’t touch the subject with a 10-foot pole.

item.title: Here's What to Know About Poland Shooting Down Russian Drones
item.description: On Wednesday morning, Poland shot down several Russian drones that entered its airspace—a first since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. The incident disrupted air travel and set the region on edge.

item.title: Right-Wing Influencers Are Turning to Foreign Affairs
item.description: Conservative creators are increasingly focusing on foreign policy. Whether they’re emissaries from or to the US isn’t always entirely clear.

item.title: A New Platform Is Launching to Protect Public Servants From an Angry Mob
item.description: From data-removal services to threat monitoring, the Public Service Alliance says its new marketplace will help public servants defend themselves in an era of data brokers and political violence.

item.title: Defense Department Scrambles to Pretend It’s Called the War Department
item.description: President Donald Trump said the so-called Department of War branding is to counter the “woke” Department of Defense name.

item.title: Tech CEOs Praise Donald Trump at White House Dinner
item.description: At a White House dinner Thursday night, America’s tech executives put on an uncanny display of fealty to Donald Trump.

item.title: US Congressman’s Brother Lands No-Bid Contract to Train DHS Snipers
item.description: DHS says retired Marine sniper Dan LaLota’s firm is uniquely qualified to meet the government’s needs. LaLota tells WIRED his brother, GOP congressman Nick LaLota, played no role in the contract.

item.description: DHS says retired Marine sniper Dan LaLota’s firm is uniquely qualified to meet the government’s needs. LaLota tells WIRED his brother, GOP congressman Nick LaLota, played no role in the contract.

item.title: Anti-Vaxxers Rejoice at Florida’s Scheme to End Vaccine Mandates for Kids and Everyone Else
item.description: As experts warn about possible outbreaks of diseases like polio and measles in Florida, anti-vaxxers declare “freedom.”

item.title: State Department Agents Are Now Working With ICE on Immigration
item.description: The State Department’s law enforcement arm is now involved in immigration enforcement, an area solidly outside its usual duties. One source compares it to IRS agents investigating espionage at NASA.

item.title: No, Trump Can’t Legally Federalize US Elections
item.description: The United States Constitution is clear: President Donald Trump can’t take control of the country’s elections. But he can sow confusion and fear.

item.title: SSA Whistleblower’s Resignation Email Mysteriously Disappeared From Inboxes
item.description: Less than 30 minutes after the Social Security Administration’s chief data officer resigned following a whistleblower complaint, recipients could no longer access the resignation email.

item.title: FEMA's Chaotic Summer Has Gone From Bad to Worse
item.description: Following a week of strife at the disaster relief agency, Homeland Security secretary Kristi Noem told FEMA employees to “be vocal” about their positive experiences with the Trump administration.

item.title: DOGE Operatives Are Joining Donald Trump’s New National Design Studio
item.description: Many proposed NDS projects were already in the works from federal workers who were let go earlier this year. Now, DOGE is getting involved.

item.title: Top CDC Officials Resign After Director Is Pushed Out
item.description: The exodus has set off alarms among staff at the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: “My main concern is they will be replaced with puppets."

item.title: The Magic Phrase Behind Donald Trump’s Power Grab
item.description: The Trump administration frequently invokes the president’s priorities to justify its actions—regardless of whether they align with the law.

item.title: How DOGE Set Up a Shadow X Account for a Government Agency
item.description: In February, DOGE affiliates at the SBA set up an X account and solicited whistleblower complaints. “It’s like having a crazy uncle who decides to be the cops,” a government auditor tells WIRED.

item.title: How DOGE Set Up a Shadow X Account for a Government Agency
item.description: In February, DOGE affiliates at the SBA set up an X account and solicited whistleblower complaints. “It’s like having a crazy uncle who decides to be the cops,” a government auditor tells WIRED.

item.title: It's the Economy, Donald
item.description: As US labor and inflation data seemingly worsen, the White House refrain is “no panicans”—in other words, no room for panic. That isn’t keeping everyone in Trumpworld from getting the jitters.

item.title: A DOGE AI Tool Called SweetREX Is Coming to Slash US Government Regulation
item.description: Named for its developer, an undergrad who took leave from UChicago to become a DOGE affiliate, a new AI tool automates the review of federal regulations and flags rules it thinks can be eliminated.

item.title: A DOGE AI Tool Called SweetREX Is Coming to Slash US Government Regulation
item.description: Named for its developer, an undergrad who took leave from UChicago to become a DOGE affiliate, a new AI tool automates the review of federal regulations and flags rules it thinks can be eliminated.

item.title: The First Federal Cybersecurity Disaster of Trump 2.0 Has Arrived
item.description: The breach of the US Courts records system came to light more than a month after the attack was discovered. Details about what was exposed—and who’s responsible—remain unclear.

item.title: James Talarico Is on the Run
item.description: WIRED spoke with the Texas state representative, who is hiding out in Illinois along with his colleagues in an attempt to stop Republicans from enacting an unprecedented redistricting plan.

item.title: Ex-NSA Chief Paul Nakasone Has a Warning for the Tech World
item.description: At the Defcon security conference in Las Vegas on Friday, Nakasone tried to thread the needle in a politically fraught moment while hinting at major changes for the tech community around the corner.

item.title: The FBI's Jeffrey Epstein Prison Video Had Nearly 3 Minutes Cut Out
item.description: Metadata from the “raw” Epstein prison video shows approximately 2 minutes and 53 seconds were removed from one of two stitched-together clips. The cut starts right at the “missing minute.”

item.title: Metadata Shows the FBI’s ‘Raw’ Jeffrey Epstein Prison Video Was Likely Modified
item.description: There is no evidence the footage was deceptively manipulated, but ambiguities around how the video was processed may further fuel conspiracy theories about Epstein’s death.
